metadata.rationale: Extracted from canonical script and scene co-occurrence data.

data.description: John is a stocky I.T. worker who appears to have spent little time outside, looking like he hasn't seen daylight in years. He is one of two I.T. staff members stationed at a pair of incredibly messy desks surrounded by half-repaired computers and equipment. He is notably unkempt, eating an Egg McMuffin with sauce smeared on his chin and shirt, and introduces himself with a lewd, self-aggrandizing manner, referring to himself as 'Thor.'
data.dialogue_summary: John has a single line of dialogue in which he greets Dante lewdly while sucking sauce off his McMuffin, saying 'HI DANTE. THOR.' and motioning to himself â€” introducing himself by a self-appointed nickname rather than his actual name.

inferred_traits.rationale: John refers to himself as 'Thor' upon meeting a stranger, suggesting he has constructed a grandiose self-image despite his disheveled, sauce-covered appearance.
His lewd behavior and self-referential nickname suggest he compensates for social isolation with performative confidence rather than genuine ease.
His messy desk, sauce-covered appearance, and multiple open condiments suggest he is entirely unbothered by mess or the impression he makes on others.
While Tennessee skittishly looks away, John lingers, winks, and speaks up, indicating he is the more socially assertive of the two I.T. workers.

data.name: JOHN

relationships.evidence: Both are introduced together as the I.T. gentlemen sharing the same messy desk area.
John winks at Dante and greets her lewdly upon being introduced during the office tour.
relationships.relationship_type: new acquaintance / object of lewd greeting

relationships.evidence: Greta introduces John to Dante as one of the hardest-working I.T. staff.
